topic_or_construct: Perceived policy impact on societal status
measured_by: single-item 1–7 Likert rating: “How much would implementing these changes influence people’s levels of status, resources, or prestige in society?”
justification: In Study 1, participants were asked to rate each policy on a 1 (Not at all) to 7 (Very much) scale for how much it would influence societal status.

topic_or_construct: Perceived policy impact on American identity
measured_by: single-item 1–7 Likert rating: “How much would implementing these changes influence who fits in American culture and identity, or who is seen as American?”
justification: The Procedure section of Study 1 describes a second 1–7 question assessing perceived influence of each policy on American cultural identity.

topic_or_construct: Expected policy support of racial groups
measured_by: 1–7 Likert rating of perceived support (1 = Strongly oppose, 7 = Strongly in favor) for each target group
justification: Participants “indicated their best guesses of the degree to which several U.S. racial groups support those policies (1 = Strongly oppose, 7 = Strongly in favor).”

topic_or_construct: Perceived affectedness of racial groups by policies
measured_by: 1–7 Likert rating of how much each group is affected (1 = Not at all, 7 = A lot)
justification: In Study 2b, participants “indicated their perceptions of how much groups are affected by these policies (1 = Not at all, 7 = A lot).”

measured_by: Coalition-sorting task placing racial groups into advocacy clusters for or against each policy
justification: Study 2b used a sorting task where “participants sorted racial groups into as many or few coalitions as desired” to capture expectations of coalition formation.

topic_or_construct: Perceived societal status of fictional immigrant group
measured_by: Rating item (1–7): “how much Gestavians have resources, status, and prestige in society” plus forced-choice high- vs low-status check
justification: Study 3’s manipulation check asked participants to rate Gestavians on resources, status and prestige, providing the measure of perceived status.

topic_or_construct: Perceived Americanness of fictional immigrant group
measured_by: Rating item (1–7): “how much Gestavians fit into American culture” plus forced-choice assimilated vs unassimilated check
justification: Participants also rated “how much Gestavians fit into American culture,” which served as the measure of perceived Americanness.

measured_by: 1–7 Likert rating of own support for each policy (1 = Strongly oppose, 7 = Strongly in favor)
justification: Across Studies 2 and 5, all participants reported their personal support of the same policies using the 1–7 scale.

topic_or_construct: Strategic political decision-making to adjust other groups’ influence
measured_by: Choice of voting procedure favoring Black vs Asian electorate and allocation of volunteers/time between communities
justification: Study 5 assessed strategy by having Whites select a voting type that increased either Black or Asian influence and divide get-out-the-vote resources between those communities.
